snippet: Neil deGrasse Tyson, an astrophysicist and the director of the Hayden Planetarium, warns that recent cosmic activity should be seen as “a shot across our bow.”
abstract: Clyde Haberman Baking Bread column on Hayden Planetarium director Neil deGrasse Tyson, who warns recent cosmic activity could imperil Earth, and that government should pay more attention to the universe as a whole.
lead_paragraph: Neil deGrasse Tyson, an astrophysicist and the director of the Hayden Planetarium, warns that recent cosmic activity should be seen as “a shot across our bow.”

headline.seo: To Planetarium Director, Siberia Meteor Showed Value of Science
headline.main: To at Least One Earthling, Siberia Meteor Proved That Science Is Vital
headline.print_headline: To at Least One Earthling, Siberia Meteor Proved That Science Is Vital
